PAGE_DESCRIPTION: With Shanti the Rickshaw, discover India and win a trip!
MENU_MAIN_SCROLL: A game offered by Shanti Travel - Creation & project: Mathieu Rodic - Drawings: Camille Rodic - Drawings helpers: Emma Bornai (trees) & Laszlo Halak (background) - Music: Atul Kamble - Copyright 2013
MENU_EMAIL_P1: To participate, write your email address in the field below:
MENU_EMAIL_P2: Earn the best score in Shanti the Rickshaw, and win a one-week tripat Nimmu House (Ladakh) in July or August 2014 or in Dune (Pondicherry) in 2014...
MENU_PLAY_P: To win a trip in India, emter your email address in the field and get the best score at the game! See the full terms and conditions below.
MENU_PLAY_BUTTON_1: Play without giving your email address
MENU_HELP_ITEMS_NEWSPAPER: Newsletter... a little reading does not hurt!
MENU_HELP_ITEMS_CHILI: Chili, often eaten along with some dishes
MENU_HELP_ITEMS_COCONUT: Coconut, used for cooking or as an offering
MENU_HELP_ITEMS_LIME: Lime, used for cooking or as an offering
MENU_HELP_ITEMS_WADAPAW: Wada Paw, sandwich typical in Southern India
MENU_HELP_ITEMS_RICE: Curry rice, a very common dish in Sri Lanka
MENU_HELP_ITEMS_PAAN: Sweet paan, a digestive mouth freshener
MENU_HELP_ITEMS_TIFFIN: Tiffin, stacked lunchboxes to keep your meals warm
MENU_HELP_ITEMS_WATER: Bottle of water... the weather is hot, don't forget to hydrate!
MENU_HELP_ITEMS_BANANA: Banana, consumed as a dessert or used as an offering
MENU_HELP_ITEMS_SHANTI: Shanti Travel, your point of reference!
MENU_HELP_ITEMS_MOUSTACHE: Moustache, manliness symbol exhibited by most men
MENU_HELP_ITEMS_OM: Om, sacred syllable in Buddhism and Hinduism
GAME_OVERLAY_PAUSE_0: Press <escape> to get back to the main menu
